business.headline: Sukanya Samriddhi vs equity: Where should you invest for your daughter's future?Investing for your daughter is not just about saving money, it is about choosing the right balance between safety and growth. Sukanya Samriddhi and equities represent two very different strategies, and understanding them can help you make a smarter decision.

India's insurance mis-selling problem may finally get a commission fixRegulators and industry experts point to the existing commission structure as a key reason behind insurance mis-selling. Under the current system, insurance agents earn a large share of their commission in the first year of a policy.

EPFO plans instant UPI withdrawals: Launch timeline, claim time and key detailsGetting your EPF money may soon become much faster. EPFO plans to roll out a new UPI-enabled app that could allow near-instant withdrawals. Here's what we know so far about the launch schedule and claim timelines.

White House releases India–US trade deal factsheet after Trump's 'zero tariff' remarkIn the coming weeks, both countries are expected to implement the framework and work towards finalising an interim agreement. Negotiations will continue on unresolved issues such as technical standards, services, and intellectual property, etc.

10 common health insurance myths that can cost you moneyClose to half of all health expenses in the country are still paid directly by households from their own savings. This combination makes misunderstandings about insurance far more expensive than they appear.
Why good borrowers still don't get loans in India, and what lenders must fixA high income and solid credit score mean little if lenders' systems can't "see" the borrower holistically.

5 key PAN rule changes in draft income tax rules that may impact daily transactionsThe government's draft income tax rules propose several changes to when PAN must be quoted for common financial transactions. From cash deposits to hotel bills and vehicle purchases, these proposed updates could affect how people handle everyday payments and paperwork.

Want smoother approvals for future loans? Start tracking those small borrowingsSmaller loans deserve particular attention. Consumer durable EMIs, short-term personal credit and buy-now-pay-later products are now common entry points into formal credit. They are designed to make life easier. But they also test discipline.

Who is Bhavnish Lathia? Kotak Mahindra Bank CTO steps down within a yearIn a regulatory filing, Kotak Mahindra Bank said Bhavnish Lathia has stepped down as Chief Technology Officer (CTO). The bank stated that his resignation was accepted on February 9, 2026 and that he completed his last working day on the same date.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as FIIs return to D-Street after India-US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex added 260.37 points to 84,326.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 77.30 points to 25,944.60 as of 10:15 am.

Delhi 5-star hotel rates cross Rs 10 lah per day and AI plays a roleAI was already under fire for threatening jobs and changing the way people work. Now, it seems to be hitting wallets in an unexpected way.

India eyes diverse energy import sources, to ensure stable and affordable supplyThe Foreign Secretary's statement came amid questions over India's purchases of Russian oil, following remarks by US President Donald Trump last week that India had "committed to stop directly or indirectly" importing Russian crude.

Aye Finance IPO opens: Should you subscribe? Check GMP and other detailsFounded in 1993, Aye Finance is an NBFC that provides secured and unsecured loans to micro and small businesses. Its products include working capital loans, mortgage-backed loans and property-based financing for businesses in manufacturing, trading and services.

Fractal Analytics IPO opens today: Check price band, GMP and key detailsThe latest grey market premium for Fractal Analytics IPO stands at Rs 17, suggesting an estimated listing price of around Rs 917 and a possible gain of about 1.9% per share.
Sensex ends 485 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; SBI jumps 8%The S&P BSE Sensex added 485.35 points to end at 84,065.75, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 173.50 points to close at 25,867.30.

Who settles insurance claims fastest in 2026? Check if your insurer is in top 10Many people buy insurance to make sure their family is financially safe if something unexpected happens. But buying a policy is only one part of the decision. The bigger question is whether the insurer will actually pay the claim on time.

Draft Income-tax Rules 2026 and new forms out: What changes for taxpayers?The drafts have been opened for public comments for 15 days, until February 22, 2026. The tax department has invited taxpayers, professionals and industry bodies to review the proposals and share feedback, saying the aim is to make the rule-making process more participative and practical.

India's GDP to grow 6.4% in FY27, fastest among G-20 nations: Moody'sThe global rating agency said steady economic growth will create a solid base for financial stability and support credit demand across sectors.

Gold rises Rs 3,000, silver up Rs 13,000: Will prices go up further?A sudden spike in gold and silver prices has put bullion back in the spotlight. The rally has shifted focus to the next big question: are prices set to rise even further?

Think the middle class got nothing in Budget 2026? Here are the hidden gainsMany middle-class taxpayers finished listening to Budget 2026 with a sense of disappointment. No big announcements, no instant tax relief. But look closer, and the Budget reveals a series of quieter reforms that could meaningfully ease everyday financial pressures.

entertainment.headline: I pointed the gun, asked them to leave: Govinda recalls handling intruders at home Govinda shared more details about the incident involving a group of unidentified men entering his residence recently. The actor confirmed that he used his licensed gun to scare them away.

Nick Jonas calls Priyanka Chopra's Varanasi incredible, praises her dedication Priyanka Chopra's return to Indian cinema with SS Rajamouli's Varanasi is already creating global buzz. Nick Jonas praised her dedication to the film, calling the ambitious project "incredible."

Govinda responds after wife Ssunita says he didn't help son Yashvardhan's career Govinda responds to wife Sunita Ahuja's criticism over lack of support for their son Yashvardhan. The actor didn't take his wife's name but reacted to his son's career in the industry.

Salman Khan, Sanjay Dutt appear in Saudi film 7 Dogs trailer; fans can't keep calm The trailer of Saudi action film 7 Dogs featuring Salman Khan and Sanjay Dutt was released recently. Their cameo roles have sparked excitement and widespread social media reactions among fans.

Selena Gomez shares proud godmother moment from Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show Pop star Selena Gomez shares a heartfelt glimpse of her goddaughter during Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show. A proud moment, a cultural connection, and more behind the story.

The economy of outrage: Maths and psychology behind Bollywood's negative PR surge As the line between organic backlash and manufactured outrage blurs, Bollywood faces a new era of negative PR. Low-cost memes and algorithmic cycles now shape public perception faster than trailers, leaving actors to navigate a digital landscape where reputation is often engineered.

Sonu Sood asks industry to help after Rajpal Yadav faces jail in cheque bounce case Actor Sonu Sood has appealed to the film industry to support Rajpal Yadav after the actor surrendered in a Rs 2.5 crore cheque bounce case. Calling for dignity over charity, Sood urged producers and directors to offer Yadav work.

No money, no friends: Rajpal Yadav shares ordeal as he surrenders to court Rajpal Yadav surrendered at Tihar Jail after the Delhi High Court denied his plea for more time in a cheque-bounce case. The actor admitted to facing financial difficulties, saying he has no money to repay and must handle the crisis on his own.

Why did Lady Gaga say yes to Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show? She answers Lady Gaga joined Bad Bunny for a historic Super Bowl halftime show performed largely in Spanish. From surprise appearances to a powerful message, here's why she said yes to the collaboration.

Karan Johar says working with Saroj Khan left him traumatised: She never liked me Karan Johar recalled a high-pressure encounter with Saroj Khan during the filming of Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge. After a costume shortage led him to suggest a makeshift "style" choice, the legendary choreographer's demand for perfection left the young assistant director traumatised and racing for fabric.

Trust his decision: Babul Supriyo on Arijit Singh stepping away from playback Babul Supriyo has backed Arijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing, saying the singer must have thought it through carefully.

The story of couple who had a real dream wedding at Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show A couple from Ontario, California, unexpectedly married live during Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show after inviting the artist to their wedding as a joke. Here's how they had a dream wedding at one of the most historical Super Bowl shows.

Amitabh Bachchan invites neighbour home after Sunday darshan video goes viral A Mumbai resident, particularly Amitabh Bachchan's neighbour, was invited to Jalsa, the superstar's home, after his viral Instagram video about the actor's Sunday greetings caught the star's attention.

Jana Nayagan censor row: High Court allows makers of Vijay film to withdraw case The makers of Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan have been permitted to withdraw their case against the censor board by the Madras High Court. It is said that they are targetting a February release.

This is not a theatre: Ajith snaps at unruly fans at Abu Dhabi racing track Actor Ajith Kumar lost his cool at the Abu Dhabi racing track due to unruly fans. He is participating in the Asian Le Mans Series endurance race.

Was Akshay Kumar's Bhooth Bangla originally Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2? T-Series clarifies T-Series has clarified that there is no connection between Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Bhooth Bangla. The studio denied all rumours about script reuse and reaffirmed its ownership of the franchise, warning against unauthorised use.

BTS members face security concerns at airport; fans express outrage BTS members faced chaotic scenes and security challenges at Incheon Airport during their comeback preparations. The incident raises urgent questions about idol safety and the need for stricter fan management.
Why Kumud Mishra's performance in Vadh 2 feels so unsettling In Vadh 2, Kumud Mishra steps away from his usual soft-spoken roles to play a fierce and intimidating jail superintendent.

Zoya Akhtar working on Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara sequel, original trio back: Report Zoya Akhtar is planning to revive her Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara world with a sequel soon. A report has suggested that the original trio is likely to be back for the project.

general news.headline: Driver behind Lamborghini wheel: Tycoon defends son, claims car malfunctionedSpeaking to reporters, Kanpur tobacco baron KK Mishra said the Lamborghini was being driven by a man identified as Mohan, while his son Shivam was seated inside the vehicle.

Opposition submits no-confidence motion against Om Birla, seeks his removalCongress MP Gaurav Gogoi said the notice was submitted at 1:14 pm under Rule 94C of the Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business. The proposal carries the signatures of around 119 MPs.

Gen Naravane book mystery deepens: We saw it, but publisher says it doesn't existPenguin Randomhouse, the publisher of Gen MM Naravane's memoir, has issued a statement denying that it printed the book. This deepens the mystery of how a printed hardbound copy of Four Stars of Destiny, yet to be approved by the Defence Ministry, reached Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. It seems the book exists, and yet it doesn't.

Why PM skipped House: Minister shares video citing chaos by women Opposition MPsThe video showed women Congress MPs surrounding the seat and refusing to move despite requests by Kiren Rijiju and Giriraj Singh, only minutes before Prime Minister Narendra Modi was scheduled to deliver his speech.

Ladki Bahin, Ayushman Bharat in Bangladesh? Manifestos echo India schemesThe Bangladesh elections have seen heavy emphasis on freebies and social schemes in party manifestos, many of which closely resemble India's long-running welfare programmes. In this article, we will outline how the poll promises of the BNP and Jamaat match our own desi yojanas.

48 hours before Bangladesh polls, Hindu trader stabbed to death in his shopThe deceased has been identified as Sushen Chandra Sarkar (62), a rice trader and owner of "Messrs Bhai Bhai Enterprise" at Bogar Bazar intersection in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district.

CCTV shows bodyguards of tycoon's son rushing to his aid after Lamborghini crashThe CCTV footage, captured shortly before and after the accident, does not establish who was driving the Lamborghini at the time of the accident, as the vehicle's windows were covered with dark tint.

Live: Lok Sabha resumes, Shashi Tharoor kicks off Budget discussionParliament Session Live Updates: Women MPs from the BJP have written to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla seeking the "strictest possible action, under the rules," against Opposition MPs over the February 4, 2026, ruckus in the House. The letter accuses Opposition members of entering the well, climbing the Speaker's table and disrupting proceedings. Meanwhile, the Parliamentary Committee on External Affairs will meet today, the same day the India bloc is set to hold a meeting at 10 am. Stay with IndiaToday.in for latest and live updates.

Sachin Tendulkar honours India's U19 captain Ayush Mhatre with special giftIndia captain Ayush Mhatre received a special gift from Sachin Tendulkar after the U19 World Cup title win upon his return to Mumbai. Mhatre led India to their sixth U19 World Cup triumph.

I believe Naravane over Penguin: Rahul Gandhi as mystery around book deepensCongress MP Rahul Gandhi backed General (Retd.) MM Naravane amid the massive controversy surrounding his unpublished book 'Four Stars of Destiny', saying that he believes him over the publisher, Penguin.

Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg seen at 'wild' dinner party with Epstein in new filesIn the newly released trove of Jeffrey Epstein files, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg are pictured as guests at a swanky dinner party, which the sex offender termed "wild".

No money, no friends: Rajpal Yadav shares ordeal as he surrenders to courtRajpal Yadav surrendered at Tihar Jail after the Delhi High Court denied his plea for more time in a cheque-bounce case. The actor admitted to facing financial difficulties, saying he has no money to repay and must handle the crisis on his own.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 22 | The Thundering Thandhai: Contradictions & ClashesThe decades between the 1940s and the 1960s unfolded like a relentless human storm, with the "Bellwether Mind" of the man now increasingly hailed as Thandhai Periyar whipping up clashes and contradictions that both electrified and eroded the Southern landscape.

Paper Tiger Pakistan's India boycott bluff that fooled no oneT20 World Cup 2026: What began as a bold stand in the name of solidarity quickly unravelled, as Pakistan's India boycott met financial reality, ICC pragmatism and a rivalry too valuable, too loud and too lucrative to quietly abandon.

Curfew imposed, internet suspended in Manipur's Ukhrul after fresh violenceFresh violence in Manipur's Ukhrul district has led to a strict security clampdown with curfew and internet suspension to restore peace. Residents fled their homes amid arson and gunfire, prompting urgent government intervention.

US-Bangladesh sign trade deal, Trump slashes tariffs by 1%Bangladesh has secured a reduced 19 per cent tariff on exports to the US under a new trade agreement. The US, initially, had proposed tariffs of up to 37 per cent on Bangladeshi exports in April.

Watch: Astro Shux's space dance explains how gravity worksGp. Capt. Shubhanshu Shukla spent about 18 days aboard the International Space Station (ISS) during the Axiom-4 (Ax-4) mission in June-July 2025. Shukla conducted dozens of experiments, helping India prepare for future astronaut missions.

Anthropic AI safety engineer Mrinank Sharma resigns, says world is falling apartMrinank Sharma, an AI safety researcher at Anthropic, has resigned from his position. In a cryptic post on social media, Mrinank hints there is more to the AI work within Anthropic than what meets the eye, and that he no longer wants to do it. Instead, he wants to write and pursue a degree in poetry.

Why UPSC's red line on repeat attempts is a tough reformFor years, the UPSC allowed already-selected officers to reappear in the Civil Service Examination. While they sought "better" services, seats for fresh aspirants shrunk. This drained public resources too. The UPSC, with the new rule, is trying to curb the practice. There are some inter-services power dynamics, too, at play in the story.

Delhi 5-star hotel rates cross Rs 10 lah per day and AI plays a roleAI was already under fire for threatening jobs and changing the way people work. Now, it seems to be hitting wallets in an unexpected way.
Why Kumud Mishra's performance in Vadh 2 feels so unsettlingIn Vadh 2, Kumud Mishra steps away from his usual soft-spoken roles to play a fierce and intimidating jail superintendent.

UK to get 1st Muslim PM? Shabana Mahmood in focus amid Starmer's Epstein scandalAs Keir Starmer struggles to steady his leadership after the Epstein files shook Downing Street, speculation has grown over who could succeed him as the UK Prime Minister. Among the names gaining traction is Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood.

Has Sarvam AI really beaten ChatGPT, Google Gemini? YES and NOSarvam AI has been at the centre of many discussions on social media in the past couple of days. The Indian AI company has outperformed ChatGPT and Google Gemini in some key areas. So, can we say Sarvam AI has beaten the best, including Google Gemini and ChatGPT? Yes and no.

Jana Nayagan censor row: High Court allows makers of Vijay film to withdraw caseThe makers of Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan have been permitted to withdraw their case against the censor board by the Madras High Court. It is said that they are targetting a February release.

sports.headline: Life without Starc, Cummins, Hazlewood: Marsh backs Australia's bowling attack T20 World Cup 2026: Despite the absences of the big three pace trio of Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood, Mitchell Marsh has backed the inexperienced Australian bowling attack to step up during the T20 World Cup.

Canada's Harsh Thaker urges for more international cricket exposure T20 World Cup 2026: After their brave fight against South Africa, Canada's Harsh Thaker is hoping that the associate nation will get more international cricket exposure in the future.

Pak cricket chief Mohsin Naqvi questioned over India boycott U-turn. Video PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi defended Pakistan's withdrawal of their T20 World Cup boycott threat, insisting talks with the ICC focused on Bangladesh. Naqvi was questioned by a reporter hours before the Pakistan government confirmed the U-turn on Monday.

FC Barcelona President Joan Laporta steps down, but a return may not be far away Joan Laporta stepped down as FC Barcelona president on Monday to contest re-election. The resignation triggers elections on March 15, with Laporta widely favoured to return and resume office from July 1.

No Asia Cup repeat: Hafeez demands sportsmanship as IND-PAK boycott drama ends After the India vs Pakistan boycott saga has come to an end, Mohammad Hafeez is hoping that there is no Asia Cup rerun between the arch-rivals during their T20 World Cup 2026 clash on February 15.

What more must Axar Patel do? Ex-India batter blasts new BCCI contract list Former India batter Aakash Chopra feels Axar Patel has been treated unfairly after he was given a Grade-C contract in the latest BCCI list released on Monday, February 9. Axar is currently India's T20I vice-captain.

Boycott drama over: Pakistan now battle past demons vs USA T20 World Cup: Pakistan's boycott drama over India is finally behind them. Now Salman Ali Agha's side face old demons against the USA, knowing another slip could leave their Super 8 hopes hanging on results elsewhere.

Between mails and a World Cup dream: Story of Saqib and Zach Lion-Cachet T20 World Cup: The Netherlands' World Cup journey is built as much on day jobs and distant dreams as it is on runs and wickets. At the Arun Jaitley Stadium, Zak leon-cash-ay's spell in the nets captures that quiet hope perfectly.

Paper Tiger Pakistan's India boycott bluff that fooled no one T20 World Cup 2026: What began as a bold stand in the name of solidarity quickly unravelled, as Pakistan's India boycott met financial reality, ICC pragmatism and a rivalry too valuable, too loud and too lucrative to quietly abandon.

Sachin Tendulkar honours India's U19 captain Ayush Mhatre with special gift India captain Ayush Mhatre received a special gift from Sachin Tendulkar after the U19 World Cup title win upon his return to Mumbai. Mhatre led India to their sixth U19 World Cup triumph.

Sri Lanka President thanks Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif for India boycott U-turnT20 World Cup: Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake thanked Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif after Pakistan confirmed it will play India on February 15 in Colombo. The U-turn ended boycott uncertainty around the T20 World Cup's biggest fixture.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand, Pakistan look to strengthen Super 8 chancesT20 World Cup 2026, Matchday preview: Day 4 of the Men's T20 World Cup features a high-stakes triple-header, with Namibia vs Netherlands, Netherlands vs UAE, and a marquee Pakistan vs USA clash across New Delhi and Chennai.

Lungi Ngidi, Aiden Markram star as South Africa take down Canada for clinical startT20 World Cup, SA vs CAN: South Africa made a spectacular start to their campaign, defeating Canada by 57 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Aiden Markram scored a brilliant fifty, while Lungi Ngidi starred with a four-wicket haul to seal the win.

Pakistan's U-turn on India boycott, to play T20 World Cup clash as scheduledT20 World Cup 2026: The much-anticipated India-Pakistan clash will go ahead on February 15 in Colombo, the Pakistan government confirmed. Citing "outcomes achieved" and requests from friendly countries, Pakistan has cleared its team to take the field.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan nears U-turn on India boycott, final word on TuesdayT20 World Cup 2026: The much-anticipated India–Pakistan clash is set to go ahead as per the original schedule on February 15 in Colombo, with official confirmation expected within the next 24 hours.

Bangladesh's absence from T20 World Cup regrettable, no sanctions on BCB: ICCThe International Cricket Council (ICC) said Bangladesh's absence from the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 was unfortunate, but confirmed that the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) will not face any financial, sporting or administrative punishment.

Bangladesh writes to PCB, urges Pakistan not to boycott India match in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has requested Pakistan to play their T20 World Cup match against India scheduled for February 15 in Colombo. Earlier, the Pakistan government had announced that the team would boycott the match.

Not many like Shubman Gill: Man United great applauds India star's humilityFormer England footballer Rio Ferdinand met India's Test and ODI captain Shubman Gill in Paris on Monday and later shared his admiration for the young cricketer on Instagram.

Pakistan on facing USA in grudge match: Learn from the past, don't dwell on itT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan fast bowler Salman Mirza said the team is looking forward to facing the USA, who stunned them in the opening match of last year's tournament. Mirza also addressed the uncertainty surrounding the India–Pakistan clash scheduled for February 15

Jemimah rewarded with promotion in BCCI contracts after heroic World Cup showJemimah Rodrigues has earned a promotion to Grade B in the BCCI central contract following her heroic showing at the Women's World Cup, highlighted by a brilliant century against Australia in the semi-final.

Uncertainty over India match, but Pakistan prepare as usual in ColomboT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan fast bowler Salman Mirza said the team is fully focused on their upcoming match against the USA on Tuesday. When asked about the scheduled India–Pakistan clash on February 15, Mirza reiterated that Pakistan's participation remains subject to government approval.

Virat and Rohit demoted, Shubman Gill promoted in BCCI annual contractsThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) on Monday announced the Annual Player Contracts for Team India Senior Men and Senior Women for the 2025–26 season, which runs from October 1, 2025 to September 30, 2026.

United States draw confidence from 2024 heroics to challenge Pakistan againT20 World Cup, PAK vs USA: Leg-spinner Mohammad Mohsin said the United States have a stronger squad than they did in 2024 and will head into their match against Pakistan on Tuesday in Colombo with confidence.

What Vaibhav did is bullying: Sunil Gavaskar's reply to Nasser's 'ICC' jibeFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar has delivered a pointed response to English pundit Nasser Hussain, dismissing suggestions of Indian "bullying" in the ongoing Pakistan boycott controversy and instead drawing attention to what he termed "real bullying", the kind displayed with a bat in hand.

ICC T20 World Cup: Namibia and Netherlands call for a level playing fieldNamibia and the Netherlands face off in the ICC T20 World Cup on Tuesday, February 10. Ahead of the contest, players from both Associate nations called for more bilateral fixtures and greater exposure against Full Member teams in the build-up to global tournaments.

SA vs CAN, highlights: South Africa beat Canada by 57 runsSA (South Africa) vs CAN (Canada) Live Score, T20 World Cup: South Africa began their T20 World Cup campaign with a convincing 57-run win over Canada in their group clash at Narendra Modi Stadium on Monday.

Pakistan seek bilateral series vs India for boycott U-turn, ICC says noT20 World Cup 2026: The International Cricket Council rejected three of the five demands put forward by the Pakistan Cricket Board in return for reversing its decision to boycott the February 15 match against India. Pakistan's demands included the resumption of bilateral series against India and a tri-series involving Bangladesh.

Dominant Zimbabwe crush Oman to mark statement T20 World Cup comebackT20 World Cup, OMA vs ZIM: Zimbabwe marked their return to the T20 World Cup with a convincing eight-wicket win over Oman. Zimbabwe bowled their opponents out for 103 and then chased down the target with 39 balls to spare.

India vs Pak controversy Highlights: Pakistan to play vs India, confirms Pak governmentIndia vs Pakistan T20 World Cup controversy Highlights: The Pakistan government announced on Monday that the team will play their T20 World Cup match against India on February 15 in Colombo. Earlier, Pakistan had threatened to boycott the clash but reversed their decision following a meeting with the ICC and BCB on Sunday.

All England keeps Super 1000 status, India Open in Delhi despite hygiene rowThe Badminton World Federation announced the calendar for the 2027–30 cycle on Monday, February 9, with the All England Open retaining its top-tier status despite speculation over a possible downgrade. Meanwhile, Delhi is set to continue hosting the India Open Super 750 event, despite controversy earlier this year surrounding hygiene standards and pollution levels in the capital.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
